page.title: 02ABERCAIRNEY ESTATE 1
page.content: {Abercairney Estate}covers 150,000 acres of land and is situated between Perth and Crieff. It employs 15 people but half of the estate is let out to tenant farmers. Employed on the estate are 3 keepers, 2 maintenance men, 2 stock men, 4 arable farmers, 2 foresters and 1 office person. The estate mostly makes its money from{fishing}and{cattle}and{sheep farming. They used to{shoot grouse}as well. Most of the woods are used for timber and Christmas trees are sent to Edinburgh for sale. They plant so many trees every year, instead of a fixed amount every time. They plant the trees very close together and when they are half grown they thin them out and use the ones they take out as Christmas trees.
